title: Designing Elementary Mathematics Language Learning Tasks Based on Smartphone Integration

context.prior_knowledge: Knowledge of basic math terminology and simple arithmetic operations
context.additional_context: CALL task design for beginner mathematics learners with language barriers. Developing reusable learning designs through pattern-based approaches.

learning_goals: Learners can accurately pronounce and use 50 beginner-level math terms through smartphone-based Computer-Assisted Language Teaching (CALT) tasks
Learners can generate language patterns including ≥3-step verbal explanations during math problem-solving processes
Learners can solve daily-life math problems (e.g., budget calculations, measurement conversions) with verbal explanations using pattern-based learning tools

resources: Speech recognition application for math terminology
constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
